title: Governor may accept federal acts
context: §29-13 Governor may accept federal acts. The governor may accept, on behalf of the State, the provisions of any act of Congress making grants or allotments of federal-aid moneys available for expenditure in the State. [L 1939, c 196, §1; RL 1945, §401; RL 1955, §12-3; HRS §29-13] Case Notes Cited: 38 H. 310, 318.
